uk.co.saiman.data

Interface SampledContinuousFunctionDecorator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ContinuousFunction, ContinuousFunctionDecorator, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Copyable<ContinuousFunction>, uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.Expression<ContinuousFunction,ContinuousFunction>, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Observable<ContinuousFunction>, SampledContinuousFunction, uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.Self<ContinuousFunction>, uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.SelfExpression<ContinuousFunction>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CalibratedContinuousFunction, SampledContinuousFunctionTransformation

    public interface SampledContinuousFunctionDecorator
extends SampledContinuousFunction, ContinuousFunctionDecorator
    A partial implementation of a SampledContinuousFunction decorator, to reduce boilerplate for functions which are in some way mappings of other functions.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface uk.co.saiman.data.ContinuousFunction

        EMPTY

      • getRange

        default uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.Range<Double> getRange()
        Description copied from interface: ContinuousFunction
        An interval containing all values in the codomain of the function. Some implementations may not quickly be able to calculate the smallest such interval, in which case they should return a close approximation guaranteed, to contain the exact smallest interval.
        Specified by:
        getRange in interface ContinuousFunction
        Specified by:

      • getIndexBelow

        default int getIndexBelow(double xValue)
        Description copied from interface: SampledContinuousFunction
        Find the nearest index with a value on the domain below, or equal to, the value given.
        Specified by:
        getIndexBelow in interface SampledContinuousFunction
        Parameters:
        xValue - The value we wish to find the nearest lower sampled neighbour to.
        Returns:
        The index of the sample adjacent and below the given value, or -1 if no such sample exists.

      • resample

        default SampledContinuousFunction resample(double startX,
                                           double endX,
                                           int resolvableUnits)
        Description copied from interface: ContinuousFunction
        Sometimes it is useful to linearise a continuous function in order to perform complex processing, or for display purposes. This method provides a linear view of any continuous function. Implementations may remove features which are unresolvable at the given resolution.
        Specified by:
        resample in interface ContinuousFunction
        Specified by:
        resample in interface ContinuousFunctionDecorator
        Specified by:
        resample in interface SampledContinuousFunction
        Parameters:
        startX - The start of the interval we wish to sample over
        endX - The end of the interval we wish to sample over
        resolvableUnits - The minimum resolvable units within the given interval
        Returns:
        A new sampled, linear continuous function roughly equal to the receiver to the requested resolution
